subject: Politics
title: Constitution Building
description: A fast breakdown of Constitution Building for builders.

hook.text: After revolution, someone has to write the new rules. Constitutions drafted in crisis often carry flaws for decades.

buildup.text: New constitutions define government structure, rights, and power limits. Getting it wrong invites future conflict.

discovery.text: Inclusive constitution-making â€” involving all factions â€” produces more stable results than winner-take-all drafting.

twist.text: Egypt's post-revolution constitution was rushed and divisive. It contributed to the military coup that followed.

climax.text: South Africa's constitution is praised as one of the world's best. It took years and broad participation to write.

punchline.text: Constitutions built in haste fail fast. Patience at the start saves decades.

quiz.question: What makes post-revolution constitutions more likely to succeed?
